metadata.title: CVE-2015-8871 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the opj_j2k_write_mco function in j2k.c inOpenJPEG before 2.1.1 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impactvia unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8871` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.1-1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.1-1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.1-1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.1-1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.1-1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.1-1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.1-1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1').
